$!You may need to tell DVLA if you've had heart failure.$!

##Car or motorcycle licence

You don't need to tell DVLA. You should stop driving for at least 1 month and only restart driving when you doctor tells you that you are safe to do so. For further information, download the leaflet 'CLE1066'.

$D
[Download 'CLE1066 - Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions' (PDF, 129KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_192828.pdf "Download 'CLE1066 - Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions' (PDF, 129KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to the address on the form. 

$D [Download 'VOCH1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 394KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065302.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you've had heart failure - download the form to let them know
title: Heart failure and driving
